definition: completely incompatible/lit. incompatible as fire and water
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Huo
(negative prefix)/not/no
surname Rong
to hold/to contain/to allow/to tolerate/appearance/look/countenance

sentences.english: And no, being financially and emotionally wealthy do not need to be mutually exclusive.
sentences.chinese: 但是，金錢富裕和情感富裕並非水火不容。

sentences.english: Some will be incompatible with others, for example, "Freedom" and "Tyranny.
sentences.chinese: 有些風格之間將水火不容，例如“自由”和“專政”。

sentences.english: Though we are in the same city, we are water and fire!
sentences.chinese: 雖然我們同在一座城市，但是水火不容。

sentences.english: Toll Access or Open Access — the two concepts seem to be irreconcilably opposed.
sentences.chinese: 付費獲取或開放獲取似乎是水火不容的兩個概念。

sentences.english: This risked a broader spillover into relations between different religions.
sentences.chinese: 這有可能導致不同宗教之間的關係更加水火不容。

sentences.english: Though the two views are not finally compatible, they can quite often be found in the same person.
sentences.chinese: 儘管這兩種看法水火不容，卻常會被同一個人持有。

definition: the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
to become enemies (idiom); to fall out with sb
arch-enemy/sworn enemy
enemy (idiom); opponent/arch-enemy
feud
to quarrel/to fall out with sb
to be awfully (busy etc)
lit. with swords drawn and bows bent (idiom); fig. a state of mutual hostility/at daggers drawn
to become enemies/to become hostile towards
to meet on the battlefield (idiom)
lit. you die, I live (idiom); irreconcilable adversaries/two parties cannot coexist
to not get along well/to be at odds
hostility/animosity
the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
see 撕破臉|撕破脸[si1 po4 lian3]
